title: How Republicans Re-engineered the Tax Code
summary: The product of years of Republican effort, the American tax code now blends traditional supply-side economics with President Trump’s populist 2024 campaign promises.

title: How Will Trump Sell His Big Policy Bill to the American Public?
summary: President Trump has spent days cajoling Republicans to support his spending bill. He will also have to sell it to a skeptical public as Democrats focus on all the ways it helps the wealthy.

title: How the Trump Administration Justified Ignoring the TikTok Ban
summary: In purporting to license otherwise illegal conduct by tech firms, President Trump set a precedent expanding executive power, legal experts warned.

title: White House to Start Notifying Countries About Tariffs, Trump Says
summary: After striking only a few trade deals since declaring a 90-day pause in April, President Trump said he would announce new duties starting Friday.

title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Deport Eight Migrants to South Sudan
summary: The court’s order followed a broader one last month allowing removals to countries with which migrants have no connections.

title: Hamas Has a New Leader in Gaza. His Next Test: Cease-Fire Talks.
summary: The rise of Izz al-Din al-Haddad in the chain of command suggests the group will hold firm to its position demanding a total end to the war before releasing all remaining hostages.

title: Where Do Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Negotiations Stand?
summary: Hamas wants to ensure that the latest cease-fire proposal has sufficient guarantees that negotiations will lead to a permanent end to the Gaza war.

title: 7 Voters on What They Love About America
summary: (And what they don’t.)

title: How the Weather Could Make Your Fireworks Fizzle
summary: Rain can put a damper on your July 4 display, and drought risks can turn a neighborhood celebration into a five-alarm fire.

title: Macy’s 4th of July Fireworks: Where to Watch in NYC
summary: The Macy’s celebration, replete with 80,000 firework shells and 11 new pyrotechnic effects, returns to the East River after heading over to the Hudson in 2024.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Large Air Barrage Hours After Trump-Putin Call
summary: It was the latest in a series of almost weekly large-scale missile and drone attacks. President Trump said he “didn’t make any progress” with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: From Cooking on TV to Feeding the Front Line in Ukraine
summary: This chef appeared on TV before joining the army when Russia invaded in 2022. Now he makes his borscht for troops instead of cooking show judges.

title: Mamdani Identified as Asian and African American on College Application
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democrat running for mayor of New York City, was born in Uganda. He doesn’t consider himself Black but said the application didn’t allow for the complexity of his background.

title: Move Over, $100 Lobster Salad. In the Hamptons, These Melons Cost $400.
summary: Gourmet grocery stores are upping their game in the Hamptons, serving a welcoming wealthy clientele.

title: Germany’s Rheinmetall, a Maker of Autos and Arms, Is Forging Stronger U.S. Ties
summary: Rheinmetall, an automotive and arms maker, is using a partnership with the builder of F-35 fighter jets to move into aviation and expand its presence in America.

title: Charlize Theron and Uma Thurman on Injuries, Action and ‘The Old Guard 2’
summary: In her return to action, Thurman is pitted against Theron in “The Old Guard 2.” The two discuss the pains and pleasures of the genre.

title: ‘The Old Guard 2’ Review: Uma Thurman vs. Charlize Theron
summary: Uma Thurman joins the expanded cast in this sure-footed sequel to the action blockbuster about a team of immortal heroes.

title: Is This Really How We’re Legislating Now?
summary: Congress is no longer in the business of thoughtful legislating. Its role has been reduced to putting political points on the board for the president.

title: In Trump’s America, Who Gets to Call Themselves American?
summary: His politicization of the name America taps into a long, well, American tradition, as old as the nation itself.

title: The Fourth
summary: Politics are colliding with the holiday this year.

title: Nobel Prize-Winning Physicist Is Stripped of Dutch Citizenship
summary: Thirteen years ago, Andre Geim took British citizenship to accept a knighthood. He has just learned he can no longer be a citizen of the Netherlands as a result.

title: Explaining the Roll Cloud Spotted in Portugal This Week
summary: A “roll cloud” spotted off the coast of Portugal looked like something out of a movie. Here’s the science behind it.

title: Could the Electric Hydrofoil Ferry Change the Way We Commute?
summary: New technology can help vessels glide quickly over water in less time and with fewer emissions than their diesel counterparts.
